tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1.7 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson presents a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Watford at Old Trafford. Scott Parker's Cottagers were looking like relegation certainties, but the former England midfielder will have still been looking for a decent performance from his players against the reigning champions. Plus, action from Brighton & Hove Albion v Southampton at the Amex Stadium, Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Turf Moor, Crystal Palace v Huddersfield Town at Selhurst Park, Leicester City v Bournemouth at the King Power Stadium and West Ham United v Everton at London Stadium.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n)

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig follows in the footsteps of Queen Victoria in the Cairngorms National Park, visiting a church that was built for the monarch but not completed until after her death.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Walsall looking for two things to save from the clutches of the tip crusher. With the help of artisan Norman Wilkinson, Sarah hopes to turn a profit.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins celebrates Mothering Sunday at the National Trust's Tyntesfield estate in Somerset, and meets a woman who has fostered over 800 children.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Richard Madley and Caroline Hawley head to Jacobs Market in Cardiff to assist two teams keen to bag a bargain in the hope that they will make a profit at auction. There are plenty of highs and lows in the saleroom and presenter Christina Trevanion also visits a local cinema to find out more about a little-known film star from Llanelli.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a house hunting couple find a country home with a budget of £700,000 in Buckinghamshire, and later visits a farm that produces high-end snail caviar.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a special Grange Hill version of the general knowledge quiz. Featuring former stars of the children's drama Todd Carty (Tucker Jenkins), Alison Bettles (Fay Lucas), Paula Ann Bland (Claire Scott), Lee MacDonald (Zammo), Erkan Mustafa (Roly), Michelle Gayle (Fiona Wilson), Francesca Martinez (Rachel Burns) and Stuart Organ (Peter Robson).(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Rural reports from Surrey. Matt Baker uncovers the story of the woman who has inspired generations of conservationists, Helen Skelton visits a biodynamic vineyard, John Craven gets some tips on keeping pigs, and Steve Brown explores the history of the Surrey landscape through sculpture. Plus, Adam Henson considers the impact of Brexit on Britain's farmers and Tom Heap reports on antibiotic-free meat. Including Weather for the Week Ahead.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Crathes Castle in Aberdeenshire. Items brought in to be valued include a royal portrait which is not all that it seems, a Cartier clock, a tiny bowl with a giant price tag, a hat once given to Ronald Reagan and a walking stick belonging to Scottish music hall star Harry Lauder.(n)

programme.title: Blue Planet Live
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Steve Backshall and Liz Bonnin conclude the week of live programmes with a look at what the future holds for the next generation of marine life, and how scientists are embracing new forms of technology to help preserve sea life. Chris studies humpback whales at the Baja Peninsula, Liz hears an underwater dawn chorus in Australia, as well as encountering turtle hatchlings and fluorescent corals, while Steve reports on one of the world's biggest gatherings of hammerhead sharks in the Bahamas. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: New series. An attack is made on a police transport carrying seized drugs, leaving three officers dead. Suspicion immediately falls on the head of a criminal syndicate, who is suspected of having police officers on his payroll providing him with information. AC-12 are assigned to investigate and root out the corrupt cops - but realise they are up against their most destructive adversary yet. The return of Jed Mercurio's police thriller, starring Adrian Dunbar, Vicky McClure, Martin Compston and Stephen Graham.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, introducing highlights of Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield and Cardiff City v Chelsea at the Cardiff City Stadium. Jurgen Klopp's Reds were looking for three points to maintain their challenge for a first top-flight title in 29 years, while Mauricio Pochettino's Spurs were aiming for their first league win at Anfield since May 2011. Cardiff were thumped 4-1 at Chelsea back in September, and both sides were desperate for three points as they sought to reach their goals at opposite ends of the table.(n)

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, and a look at the biggest issues in the women's game. Chelsea are the defending champions, but face stiff competition from the likes of the most successful English women's team in history Arsenal, last season's runners-up Manchester City and the much-improved Birmingham City.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following explorer Robert Falcon Scott's failed expedition to be the first to reach the South Pole. The extreme conditions, poor decision-making and the pressure of the race to make it to the Pole before their Norwegian rivals proved too much for the British team, resulting in tragedy in 1912. Starring John Mills, Derek Bond, James Robertson Justice, Kenneth More and John Gregson.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profile of Oscar-winning actor John Mills, featuring clips from TV appearances he made during his seven-decade career, and capturing the milestones and highlights of his fame. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets busy on the vegetable plot and takes the next step in planting up his new Paradise Garden. With Mothering Sunday around the corner, he also provides some timely inspiration for planting up a spring pot as a present. Frances Tophill is thrilled to have her own allotment this year, and here shares her plans for the season ahead, making a start on getting it shipshape. The programme also visits the alpine house at RHS Garden Wisley to find out from the experts how they care for some of the smallest and most colourful spring gems.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher presents a compilation of archive reports on food, featuring kelp growers, peppermint harvests, cider-making and valuable spices. Sean also explores Oxfordshire, meeting farmers who put a unique spin on produce from cheese to pickles. and puts together the ingredients for a perfect Ploughman's. including Weather for the Week Ahead.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King head to Bromsgrove to taste some jerk chicken and sample an authentic Birmingham Balti as their culinary tour reaches a climax. They end the adventure at WOMAD, where they make their piri piri chicken for the crowds before storming the Taste the World stage to regale the audience with tales of their travels, while cooking one chicken and one egg dish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: My Mediterranean with Adrian Chiles
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adrian gets in touch with his Catholic roots in Rome, riding a Vespa around the city with a priest and joining a crowd that has gathered to see the Pope in St Peter's Square. Adrian also attends his first confession in eight years with an 80-year-old cardinal, learns about converting to Judaism while observing the Sabbath, helps a group of nuns in the kitchen, and visits a Catholic school where most of the pupils are Muslims.(n)

programme.title: Odette
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores a diverse range of invasions as Nick Crane heads to the Channel Islands to learn about the German occupation of Guernsey during the Second World War, while Ruth Goodman goes to the Isle of Man to find out how it became the home of the TT motorcycle race, which attracts around 10,000 bikers from around the world each year.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Babies
programme.desc: Martin Hughes-Games explores the ground-breaking work being done by breeding programmes protecting some of the most threatened animals. He begins in China with the giant panda - which is being helped to become pregnant using medical techniques developed for humans. Martin also visits programmes in Jersey and Whipsnade Zoo aiming to protect the futures of the pied tamarin monkey, at risk from deforestation in Brazil, and the one-horned rhino.(n)

programme.title: Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a cheese factory in Gateshead, where 3,000 tonnes of spreadable cheese are produced every year. He follows the production of jalapeno chilli flavoured cheese, from a 28,000-litre delivery of milk to 5,400 squeezy tubes. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey finds out how bacteria are responsible for the huge variety in smell, taste and appearance of different types of cheese. She also learns that some smelly cheeses contain the same bacteria that are responsible for stinky feet. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Jenny Campbell and Tej Lalvani assess the profit-making potential of more business ideas, including a keen fisherman with a plan to market his own range of bait, a pasta home delivery service, and a brother and sister with a scheme to make money out of rubbish. Evan Davis presents.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The four remaining teams travel through Cambodia and Vietnam. Darron and Alex are 24 hours ahead of the others, but they are running out of money quickly - a trip into the jungle to work with elephants may prove the solution. Josh and Felix's partnership is strained by a visit to a brothel, while a toilet break proves to have serious consequences for Tony and Elaine.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates footage of the Australian island state's wildlife. The programme reveals a surprisingly gentle side to the island's most famous resident, the Tasmanian devil, and also features footage of rare white wallabies, venomous jack jumper ants, and caves illuminated by thousands of glow worms. Tasmania's rivers are home to platypus and giant lobsters, while on the coast, miniature penguins come ashore to breed.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian tests his preconceptions of Albania, guided on a whistlestop tour of the country by local TV presenter and journalist Erjona Rusi. Along the way, he tries to discover why Albania has remained a stubbornly unfashionable holiday destination, meeting those at the extremes of the country, from the rural farmers to the billionaire playboys who live in the cities in the company of supermodels.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to help make sense of bewildering times as he dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. Featuring contributions from Sara Pascoe, Lucy Prebble and a variety of comic guests.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: With Jo now co-managing Cachet Windows, she uses her power to expose Lavender and Sam's past and gains the upper hand over Vincent. Meanwhile, Sam attends a trade conference and is subject to constant sexist jokes from one of the company's top clients, and Vincent and the family prepare to go on holiday to Malta.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following explorer Robert Falcon Scott's failed expedition to be the first to reach the South Pole. The extreme conditions, poor decision-making and the pressure of the race to make it to the Pole before their Norwegian rivals proved too much for the British team, resulting in tragedy in 1912. Starring John Mills, Derek Bond, James Robertson Justice, Kenneth More and John Gregson.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profile of Oscar-winning actor John Mills, featuring clips from TV appearances he made during his seven-decade career, and capturing the milestones and highlights of his fame. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets busy on the vegetable plot and takes the next step in planting up his new Paradise Garden. With Mothering Sunday around the corner, he also provides some timely inspiration for planting up a spring pot as a present. Frances Tophill is thrilled to have her own allotment this year, and here shares her plans for the season ahead, making a start on getting it shipshape. The programme also visits the alpine house at RHS Garden Wisley to find out from the experts how they care for some of the smallest and most colourful spring gems.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher presents a compilation of archive reports on food, featuring kelp growers, peppermint harvests, cider-making and valuable spices. Sean also explores Oxfordshire, meeting farmers who put a unique spin on produce from cheese to pickles. and puts together the ingredients for a perfect Ploughman's. including Weather for the Week Ahead.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King head to Bromsgrove to taste some jerk chicken and sample an authentic Birmingham Balti as their culinary tour reaches a climax. They end the adventure at WOMAD, where they make their piri piri chicken for the crowds before storming the Taste the World stage to regale the audience with tales of their travels, while cooking one chicken and one egg dish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: My Mediterranean with Adrian Chiles
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adrian gets in touch with his Catholic roots in Rome, riding a Vespa around the city with a priest and joining a crowd that has gathered to see the Pope in St Peter's Square. Adrian also attends his first confession in eight years with an 80-year-old cardinal, learns about converting to Judaism while observing the Sabbath, helps a group of nuns in the kitchen, and visits a Catholic school where most of the pupils are Muslims.(n)

programme.title: Odette
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores a diverse range of invasions as Nick Crane heads to the Channel Islands to learn about the German occupation of Guernsey during the Second World War, while Ruth Goodman goes to the Isle of Man to find out how it became the home of the TT motorcycle race, which attracts around 10,000 bikers from around the world each year.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Babies
programme.desc: Martin Hughes-Games explores the ground-breaking work being done by breeding programmes protecting some of the most threatened animals. He begins in China with the giant panda - which is being helped to become pregnant using medical techniques developed for humans. Martin also visits programmes in Jersey and Whipsnade Zoo aiming to protect the futures of the pied tamarin monkey, at risk from deforestation in Brazil, and the one-horned rhino.(n)

programme.title: Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a cheese factory in Gateshead, where 3,000 tonnes of spreadable cheese are produced every year. He follows the production of jalapeno chilli flavoured cheese, from a 28,000-litre delivery of milk to 5,400 squeezy tubes. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey finds out how bacteria are responsible for the huge variety in smell, taste and appearance of different types of cheese. She also learns that some smelly cheeses contain the same bacteria that are responsible for stinky feet. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Jenny Campbell and Tej Lalvani assess the profit-making potential of more business ideas, including a keen fisherman with a plan to market his own range of bait, a pasta home delivery service, and a brother and sister with a scheme to make money out of rubbish. Evan Davis presents.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The four remaining teams travel through Cambodia and Vietnam. Darron and Alex are 24 hours ahead of the others, but they are running out of money quickly - a trip into the jungle to work with elephants may prove the solution. Josh and Felix's partnership is strained by a visit to a brothel, while a toilet break proves to have serious consequences for Tony and Elaine.(n)

programme.title: Showbands: How Ireland Learnt to Party
programme.desc: The showband was a uniquely Irish phenomenon. It was a movement that saw thousands of young people travel up and down the country in the late '50s, '60s and early '70s to the `Dancehalls of Romance' to be entertained by the Royal Showband, the Miami Showband and Big Tom and the Mainliners, and individuals including Dickie Rock, Joe Dolan and Brendan Bowyer. Ardal O'Hanlon looks back at the phenomenon, examining what triggered the infamous era, the people involved, and its eventual end in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates footage of the Australian island state's wildlife. The programme reveals a surprisingly gentle side to the island's most famous resident, the Tasmanian devil, and also features footage of rare white wallabies, venomous jack jumper ants, and caves illuminated by thousands of glow worms. Tasmania's rivers are home to platypus and giant lobsters, while on the coast, miniature penguins come ashore to breed.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The week's events from around the Province with Mark Carruthers.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: With Jo now co-managing Cachet Windows, she uses her power to expose Lavender and Sam's past and gains the upper hand over Vincent. Meanwhile, Sam attends a trade conference and is subject to constant sexist jokes from one of the company's top clients, and Vincent and the family prepare to go on holiday to Malta.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan (?)
programme.desc: The comedian tests his preconceptions of Albania, guided on a whistlestop tour of the country by local TV presenter and journalist Erjona Rusi. Along the way, he tries to discover why Albania has remained a stubbornly unfashionable holiday destination, meeting those at the extremes of the country, from the rural farmers to the billionaire playboys who live in the cities in the company of supermodels.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order (?)
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to help make sense of bewildering times as he dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. Featuring contributions from Sara Pascoe, Lucy Prebble and a variety of comic guests.(n)

programme.title: Made in Great Britain (?)
programme.desc: Steph McGovern leads the makers to Wensleydale in the Yorkshire Dales, where they examine the area's famous cheese, as championed by Wallace and Gromit. Focusing on the Monastic period, Jason and Claire try to milk a sheep, while Katie and Charlton extract rennet - an enzyme vital in cheesemaking - from a sheep's stomach. Moving on to the Victorian era, Charlton and Jason tackle the highly physical task of collecting 20 litres of milk each in heavy back cans. The makers are then propelled to the 1920s when early factories employed equipment such as thermometers to produce cheese on a much larger scale.(n)

programme.title: Scrum V (?)
programme.desc: Gareth Rhys Owen is joined by Andrew Coombs and Mark Jones to present action from the Plate and Bowl semi-finals, as well as the key moments from the Principality Premiership.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Asian Adventure (?)
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King continue their culinary journey around Asia by heading to Thailand, where they discover why Bangkok has a reputation as the street food capital of the world, and help serve up school dinners. Heading out into the country's central plains, the duo join paddy-field workers and find out how rice is grown.(n)

programme.title: My Autistic Big Brother & Me (?)
programme.desc: Documentary following a man's fight to prevent his autistic brother from being institutionalised. 47-year-old Spencer McKay finds everyday tasks a great challenge, but thrives on walking in mountain regions, coping with all weathers and the most rugged terrain. His younger brother Mikey is determined to ensure he continues to enjoy this freedom, which he believes is vital to Spencer's quality of life.(n)

programme.title: The Unexplainers (?)
programme.desc: New series. Mike Bubbins and John Rutledge investigate Wales' most mysterious mysteries, from aliens to ghost animals. They begin by examining reports of a big cat on the loose in North Wales, with a complicated mix of CCTV, woodwork and cold meat yielding some unexpected results, while they also set sail on a lake near Bala to search for a reported monster.(n)

programme.title: White Gold (?)
programme.desc: With Jo now co-managing Cachet Windows, she uses her power to expose Lavender and Sam's past and gains the upper hand over Vincent. Meanwhile, Sam attends a trade conference and is subject to constant sexist jokes from one of the company's top clients, and Vincent and the family prepare to go on holiday to Malta.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland (?)
programme.desc: Paul visits the Isle of Mull and boards a boat to the remote Treshnish Islands, where he experiences a spot of `puffin therapy' before heading to the Firth of Forth and Bass Rock.(n)

programme.title: Super 4 (?)
programme.desc: When a dragon chases the Trolls from their cave and they have nowhere to live, Ruby does not want to help them; she then discovers that their cave is filled with diamonds.(n)

programme.title: Super 4 (?)
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.(n)

programme.title: Robozuna (?)
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.(n)

programme.title: Scrambled (?)
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.(n)

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show (?)
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.(n)

programme.title: The Bagel and Becky Show (?)
programme.desc: Torgo is desperate to impress his Motherthing on Mother's Day, so Bagel and Becky help him convince her he has conquered Earth.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series (?)
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Teen Titans Go (?)
programme.desc: Cyborg becomes trapped in the alternate reality of Night Begins to Shine with a dragon who wants to steal the song for his own evil purposes.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Sunday Selection (?)
programme.desc: New series. The chef shares some of his favourite recipes and celebrity encounters from James Martin's Saturday Morning, as well as memorable moments from his adventures around the world and here in the UK. The first episode features Paul Rankin's miso beef and Omar Allibhoy's garlic mushrooms, as well as James' own Spanish spatchcock chicken and apple and rosemary tarte tatin.(n)

programme.title: This Morning - On Sunday (?)
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford present a mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions. Featuring interviews, recipes, real-life stories, fashion and exclusive behind-the-scenes stories.(n)

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen (?)
programme.desc: New series. Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The first episode features spring roast chicken, a fruity curry, Victoria sponge, cheat's raspberry jam and easy cheese scones, and a simple souffle.(n)

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury (?)
programme.desc: Julia continues her 12,000km journey across the continent in Central Australia, a huge outback region of the Northern Territory also known as the Red Centre. She begins in the town of Alice Springs, where she is persuaded to take part in a dry boat race. She also heads back to the classroom at the world's largest school, meets a retired Aussie soap star at his desert home and takes a camel ride to the sacred site of Uluru, or Ayers Rock.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK (?)
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the live semi-final, which begins by revealing which act has won the lifeline vote. The remaining performers selected by coaches Jennifer Hudson, Will.i.am, Tom Jones and Olly Murs must now give it their all if they are to win one of the four remaining places in next week's final, where they ill compete for the chance to win a recording contract. The decision over who will be going through to the last round and who will be leaving the show tonight lies entirely with the votes of the viewing public.(n)

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Gun (?)
programme.desc: James Bond's investigation into the death of a world-renowned scientist working on solar technology draws him into a battle of wits with a stealthy assassin, who dispatches his victims with a golden bullet and has the British secret agent next in his sights. Spy adventure, starring Roger Moore, Christopher Lee, Britt Ekland and Maud Adams.(n)

programme.title: The Family Chase (?)
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family-themed edition of the game show. The Lawrence-Harish family from Wolverhampton pit their general-knowledge know-how against that of professional quizzers.(n)

programme.title: What Would Your Kid Do (?)
programme.desc: Jason Manford returns with a new series of the show which asks how well we really know our kids, by challenging parents to guess what their children will do in a variety of entertaining situations. Each show sees children filmed in a school specially rigged with hidden cameras. The kids think they're taking part in a variety of classroom activities and games, unaware that we're actually testing everything from empathy and lateral thinking to curiosity and rule breaking. Back in the studio, Jason challenges the parents to predict what their child will do in each situation.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Gary demands cash from Peter to pay off Rick, while Beth and Claudia clash during Bertie's homecoming party. Meanwhile, Gina refuses to turn a blind eye to Tim's suffering.(n)

programme.title: Victoria (?)
programme.desc: As the Chartist movement turns violent, Victoria must decide whether to use force against her own people. Albert is convinced that the royal family must flee to the Isle of Wight, but Victoria is still weak from the recent birth of her sixth child, and is determined to stay in London regardless of the threat. Skerrett is torn between her old life and new when Francatelli buys a hotel, and Lord Palmerston comes to Sophie's rescue when her carriage is overturned. Louis Phillippe has outstayed his welcome, and Albert is forced to get rid of the unwanted guest.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera (?)
programme.sub-title: Weather from Hell: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Britain has seen some of its most extreme weather in a generation during 2018. Featuring footage and dramatic stories, all filmed by people caught in the middle of extreme weather, this episode includes a lightning bolt that wrecks a home with a family inside, a man caught in an avalanche, and how a family was nearly swept away in a freak holiday storm.(n)

programme.title: The Bay (?)
programme.desc: With the Meredith family reeling from Dylan's death and Sean's arrest, Lisa is charged with finding his alibi and makes a game-changing discovery. Suspicions are raised about another Morecambe resident's involvement with the twins and the police rush to find them. Abbie grows closer to newcomer Vincent, whilst Rob agrees to take on a risky dare. Frustrated by the police investigation, Sean takes matters into his own hands. Starring Morven Christie, Jonas Armstrong, Tracie Bennett and Lindsey Coulson.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen (?)
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)
